item.title: 0-rsa_explained
item.description: Here I will explain RSA RSA RSA is an asymmetric encryption algorithm with a public key and a private key. The key generation follows Choose $p$ and $q$ large prime numbers. Calculate $N = p * q$. Calculate the Euler’s totient function of $N$, because $N$ is multiplication of 2 prime numbers, $\varphi(N) = \varphi(p) * \varphi(q) = (p - 1) * (q - 1)$. Choose exponent $e$. Calculate the inverse of $e$ in $\varphi(N)$ ring (There is an inverse only if $GCD(e, \varphi(N)) = 1$), let’s call it $d$.
